name: stealthily
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
quietly and carefully in order not to be seen or heard: The defendant stealthily entered the family home and kidnapped the daughter. A member of their group distracted the soldier while they stealthily boarded a bus for the border.
secretly, so that people do not realize what is happening: Spyware stealthily installs itself on computers. The company stealthily moved money and assets out of Africa. See
stealth
More examplesFewer examplesHe had stealthily followed his victim while in disguise.Banksy's tools are spray-paint and stencils, which enable him to work quickly and stealthily. Automakers are stealthily raising sticker prices so that the post-discount price looks better than it really is. Bioterrorism works stealthily.
